To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Radio program Town And Country Time, originally broadcast 1955-11-05 by WARL (Arlington, VA) - part 8. Special final broadcast of host Connie B. Gay, featuring in-studio and pre-recorded messages from various associates of Connie, including: Pick Temple; Charles Finley [last name unconfirmed]; Mark Evans and Billy Johnson of WTOP; Ernie Sparkman, Earl "Grandpappy" Davis, and Jimmy Oakes of Town And Country Time WTCR (Ashland, KY); James P. Davis of RCA records; Harry Berryhill, Annandale Volunteer Fire Department President; Jane Trimner, Connie's successor as Town And Country Time President; Hank Snow; Jimmy Dean and the Texas Wildcats (including Marvin Carroll, Herbie Jones, Buck Ryan, Bob Elliott, Smitty Erwin, and Dale Turner); Don Tucker of WTCS (Fairmont, WV) and Town and Country Time Vice-President; Dick Barr, WMCA (New York, NY) announcer and former WARL announcer; Sid Barbet of Buyers Associates; Ron Harrell [last name unconfirmed]; Johnny Shuto [last name unconfirmed]; Billy Grammer; "Fiddlin'" Curly Smith and Joe Brechner of WGAY (Silver Spring, MD); Byron Roudabush, Town And Country Time TV director; Murray Nash, President of Murray Nash Associates; Eddy Arnold; Bernie Harrison, writer for the Evening Star; Sam Jack Kaufman, president of the D.C. Federation of Musicians Local 161-710; Kilbourne Castell, former WARL owner; Fred Hand, manager of Constitution Hall; Fred Houwink, of WMAL-TV; Joe Wheeler of the Wheeler Brothers; Bob Keith; Ralph Case; Phil Long, Howard Fisher, and Don Owens, WARL DJs; George Crump, Commercial Manager of WARL; Ray Armand, manager of WARL; Cy Blumenthal, owner of WARL; June [Stuart/Stewart], of WTCR; George [last name unidentified]; Tom [last name unidentified], Town And Country Time Comptroller; George Rowe of the U.S. Department of Agriculture; John Anderson, Arlington Hospital Administrator; and Vince McMahon, promoter. Telegrams from Walter David Kilpatrick of Mercury Records; Mr and Mrs Everett Delozier; Representative Harold D. Cooley; Congressman Joel T. Broyhill; and Senator W. Kerr Scott are read during the program. Note: two sets of discs exist for this content, 'copy 2' is of higher audio quality.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
